name: Discrete Structures.CSCI-150
body:
**Discrete Structures, CSCI-150.**

Lecture 1. Aug 31, 2015. Propositional Logic.
Reading: R(ed6): 1.1-1.2; R(ed7): 1.1-1.3.

Lecture 2. Sep 2, 2015. Satisfiability and Rules of Inference. [handout].
Reading: R(ed6): 1.5; R(ed7): 1.6.
HW1. Due Wednesday, Sep 9.
(Notice that only problems 2, 3, 5, and 6 will be graded; you don't have to write your solutions for the other problems).

Lecture 3. Sep 9, 2015. Predicates and Quantifiers.
Reading: R(ed6): 1.3-1.4; R(ed7): 1.4-1.5.

Lecture 4. Sep 10, 2015. Proofs.
Reading: LL: Chapter 1; R(ed6): 1.6-1.7; R(ed7): 1.7-1.8.
HW2. Due Wednesday, Sep 16.

Lecture 5. Sep 16, 2015. Induction.
Reading: LL: Chapter 2; R(ed6): 4.1; R(ed7): 5.1.
HW3. Due Monday, Sep 21.

Lecture 6. Sep 21, 2015. Recurrences.
Reading: LL: Chapter 12; R(ed6): 4.4; R(ed7): 5.4.
Towers of Hanoi
HW4. Due Wednesday, Sep 30.

Also, you can play this logical game: http://incredible.nomeata.de/, where you are constructing proofs out of pieces (an example).

Lecture 7. Sep 28, 2015. Fibonacci Numbers. Solving Linear Recurrences.
Reading: LL: Chapter 13; R(ed6): 7.2; R(ed7): 8.2.
HW5. Due Wednesday, Oct 7.

Lectures 8 & 9. Sep 30, 2015. Strong Induction & Recursion in Mathematics and Programming.

Midterm 1. Oct 5, 2015.
Midterm 1 - Statistics.

Lecture 10. Oct 7, 2015. Intro to Number Theory.
Reading: Lecture notes by Prof. Saad Mneimneh;
LL: Chapters 4 and 5; R(ed6): 3.4-3.5; R(ed7): 4.1-4.3.
HW6. Due Wednesday, Oct 14.

Lecture 11. Oct 14, 2015. Modular arithmetic.
Reading: the same.
Source code of the extended Euclid's algorithm in C.
HW7. Due Wednesday, Oct 21.

Lecture 12. Oct 19, 2015. Fermat's little theorem. RSA.
Reading: The previous reading, and also LL: pp.67-68 for the fundamental theorem of arithmetic.

Lecture 12 (continued). Oct 21, 2015.
HW8. Due Wednesday, Oct 28.

Lecture 13. Oct 26, 2015. Counting. Sets.
Reading: R(ed6): 5.1; R(ed7): 6.1.

Lecture 14. Oct 28, 2015. Permutations and Combinations. The Pigeonhole Principle..
Reading: R(ed6): 5.2-5.3; R(ed7): 6.2-6.3.
HW9. Due Wednesday, Nov 4.

A video about the 6 persons theorem: Friends and Strangers Theorem.

Lecture 15. Nov 2, 2015. Binomial Theorem. Combinations with repetition.
Reading: R(ed6): 5.4-5.5; R(ed7): 6.4-6.5.

Lecture 16. Nov 4, 2015. Counting. Problem solving. [problem set].

Syllabus

Mon, Wed, 7:00 - 8:15 pm. Hunter North C107.
Office hours: after the class or by appointment.

Instructor: Alexey Nikolaev
Website: https://github.com/justnpc/csci.discrete.structures.io.git
Email: a(my last name)@gradcenter.cuny.edu
Office: HN 1000C

Literature

Rosen "Discrete Mathematics and its Applications" edition 6 or 7.
Lehman and Leighton "Mathematics for Computer Science" (2004). pdf
Grading Policy

Homeworks once a week. No late homeworks accepted. Homeworks must be handed in at the beginning of the class.

Distribution

HWs: 25%
Midterm I: 25%
Midterm II: 25%
Final: 25%.

Project

An optional project is a possibility to improve your grade, and (hopefully) do something fun.

More details will be added later.

Tentative Course Content

Aug 31 (Mon). Propositional Logic. 
Sep 2 (Wed). Satisfiability and Rules of Inference. 
Sep 7 (Mon). College is closed. 
Sep 9 (Wed). Predicates and Quantifiers. 
Sep 10 (Thr). Proofs.

Sep 14 (Mon). No classes scheduled. 
Sep 16 (Wed). Induction. 
Sep 21 (Mon). Recurrences. 
Sep 23 (Wed). No classes scheduled. 
Sep 28 (Mon). Fibonacci Numbers. Solving Linear Recurrences. 
Sep 30 (Wed). Strong Induction. Recursion in Mathematics and Programming.
Oct 1 (Thr). Review Session. 4:15 - 6:15pm.

Oct 5 (Mon). Midterm 1.

Oct 7 (Wed). Intro to Number Theory. 
Oct 12 (Mon). College is close. 
Oct 14 (Wed). Modular arithmetic. 
Oct 19 (Mon). Modular arithmetic and Extended Euclidean algorithm. 
Oct 21 (Wed). Fermat's little theorem. RSA.

Oct 26 (Mon). Counting. Intro. 
Oct 28 (Wed). The Pigeonhole Principle. Permutations and Combinations. 
Nov 2 (Mon). Binomial Theorem. Combinations with repetition. 
Nov 4 (Wed). Overcounting.
Nov 5 (Thr). Review Session. 4:20 - 6:20pm.

Nov 9 (Mon). Midterm 2.

Nov 11 (Wed). Sets. Ordered pairs. 
Nov 16 (Mon). Relations. Functions. Bijection and counting. 
Nov 18 (Wed). Relations and partial orders. 
Nov 23 (Mon). Graphs. Bipartite graphs. Paths. 
Nov 25 (Wed). Paths. Connectivity. Euler and Hamilton Paths. Planar graphs. 
Nov 30 (Mon). Trees. Huffman coding. 
Dec 2 (Wed). Probability. 
Dec 7 (Mon). Probability. Random variables. Expected value.

Dec 10 (Thr). Review Session. 4:20 - 6:20pm.

Dec 14 (Mon). Projects presentation.

Dec 21 (Mon). Final Exam. Same room. 6:20 - 8:20pm.
